Greater_Risk_Question: Currently drank alcohol
Description: at least one drink of alcohol, on at least 1 day during the 30 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever drank alcohol
Description: at least one drink of alcohol, on at least 1 day during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Had their first drink of alcohol before age 13 years
Description: other than a few sips

Greater_Risk_Question: Reported 10 or more as the largest number of drinks they had in a row
Description: within a couple of hours, during the 30 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Reported current binge drinking
Description: four or more drinks of alcohol in a row (if they were female) or five or more drinks of alcohol in a row (if they were male), within a couple of hours, on at least 1 day during the 30 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Usually got the alcohol they drank by someone giving it to them
Description: during the 30 days before the survey, among students who currently drank alcohol

Greater_Risk_Question: Currently used marijuana
Description: also called grass, pot, or weed, one or more times during the 30 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever injected any illegal drug
Description: used a needle to inject any illegal drug into their body, one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever took prescription pain medicine without a doctor's prescription or differently than how a doctor told them to use it
Description: counting drugs such as codeine, Vicodin, Oxycontin, Hydrocodone, and Percocet, one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever took steroids without a doctor's prescription
Description: pills or shots, one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever used cocaine
Description: any form of cocaine, such as powder, crack, or freebase, one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever used ecstasy
Description: also called ""MDMA,"" one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever used hallucinogenic drugs
Description: such as LSD, acid, PCP, angel dust, mescaline, or mushrooms, one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever used heroin
Description: also called ""smack,"" ""junk,"" or ""China White,"" one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever used inhalants
Description: sniffed glue, breathed the contents of aerosol spray cans, or inhaled any paints or sprays to get high, one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever used marijuana
Description: also called grass, pot, or weed, one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever used methamphetamines
Description: also called ""speed,"" ""crystal,"" ""crank,"" or ""ice,"" one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Ever used synthetic marijuana
Description: also called ""K2,"" ""Spice,"" ""fake weed,"" ""King Kong,"" ""Yucatan Fire,"" ""Skunk,"" or ""Moon Rocks,"" one or more times during their life

Greater_Risk_Question: Tried marijuana for the first time before age 13 years
Description: also called grass, pot, or weed

Greater_Risk_Question: Were offered, sold, or given an illegal drug on school property
Description: during the 12 months before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not eat breakfast
Description: during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not eat breakfast on all 7 days
Description: during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Ate fruit 1 or less times per day
Description: such as orange juice, apple juice, or grape juice, not counting punch, Kool-Aid, sports drinks, or other fruit-flavored drinks, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Ate fruit 2 or less times per day
Description: such as orange juice, apple juice, or grape juice, not counting punch, Kool-Aid, sports drinks, or other fruit-flavored drinks, during the 7 days before the survey

Description: such as orange juice, apple juice, or grape juice, not counting punch, Kool-Aid, sports drinks, or other fruit-flavored drinks, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not drink milk
Description: counting milk in a glass or cup, from a carton, or with cereal and counting the half pint of milk served at school as equal to one glass, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Drank milk 1 or less times per day
Description: counting milk in a glass or cup, from a carton, or with cereal and counting the half pint of milk served at school as equal to one glass, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Drank a can, bottle, or glass of soda or pop three or more times per day

Description: such as Coke, Pepsi, or Sprite, not counting diet soda or diet pop, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Drank soda or pop
Description: such as Coke, Pepsi, or Sprite, not counting diet soda or diet pop, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Drank a can, bottle, or glass of a sports drink one or more times per day
Description: such as Gatorade or Powerade, not counting low-calorie sports drinks such as Propel or G2, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Drank a can, bottle, or glass of a sports drink three or more times per day

Description: such as Gatorade or Powerade, not counting low-calorie sports drinks such as Propel or G2, during the 7 days before the survey

Description: green salad, potatoes (not counting French fries, fried potatoes, or potato chips), carrots, or other vegetables, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Ate vegetables 2 or less times per day
Description: green salad, potatoes (not counting French fries, fried potatoes, or potato chips), carrots, or other vegetables, during the 7 days before the survey

Description: green salad, potatoes (not counting French fries, fried potatoes, or potato chips), carrots, or other vegetables, during the 7 days before the survey

Description: green salad, potatoes (not counting French fries, fried potatoes, or potato chips), carrots, or other vegetables, during the 7 days before the survey

Description: counting tap, bottled, and unflavored sparkling water, during the 7 days before the survey

Description: counting tap, bottled, and unflavored sparkling water, during the 7 days before the survey

Description: counting tap, bottled, and unflavored sparkling water, during the 7 days before the survey

Description: counting tap, bottled, and unflavored sparkling water, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Had obesity
Description: students who were >= 95th percentile for body mass index, based on sex- and age-specific reference data from the 2000 CDC growth charts

Greater_Risk_Question: Were overweight
Description: students who were >= 85th percentile but <95th percentile for body mass index, based on sex- and age-specific reference data from the 2000 CDC growth charts

Greater_Risk_Question: Described themselves as slightly or very overweight
Were not trying to lose weight
Did not do exercises to strengthen or tone their muscles on three or more days
Description: such as push-ups, sit-ups, or weight-lifting, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not go to physical education (PE) classes on 1 or more days
Description: in an average week when they were in school

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not go to physical education (PE) classes on all 5 days
Description: in an average week when they were in school

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not play on at least one sports team
Description: counting any teams run by their school or community groups, during the 12 months before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Had a concussion from playing a sport or being physically active one or more times
Description: during the 12 months before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Played video or computer games or used a computer for 3 or more hours per day
Description: counting time spent on things such as Xbox, PlayStation, an iPad or other tablet, a smartphone, texting, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, or other social media, for something that was not school work, on an average school day

Greater_Risk_Question: Watched television 3 or more hours per day
Description: on an average school day

Greater_Risk_Question: Were not physically active at least 60 minutes per day on 5 or more days
Description: doing any kind of physical activity that increased their heart rate and made them breathe hard some of the time, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Were not physically active at least 60 minutes per day on all 7 days
Description: doing any kind of physical activity that increased their heart rate and made them breathe hard some of the time, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Were not physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes on at least 1 day
Description: doing any kind of physical activity that increased their heart rate and made them breathe hard some of the time, during the 7 days before the survey

Greater_Risk_Question: Were never tested for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
Description: not counting tests done if they donated blood

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not use a condom during last sexual intercourse
Description: among students who were currently sexually active

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not use a shot (e.g., Depo-Provera), patch (e.g., OrthoEvra), or birth control ring (e.g., NuvaRing) before last sexual intercourse
Description: to prevent pregnancy, among students who were currently sexually active

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not use an IUD (e.g., Mirena or ParaGard) or implant (e.g., Implanon or Nexplanon) before last sexual intercourse
Description: to prevent pregnancy, among students who were currently sexually active

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not use any method to prevent pregnancy during last sexual intercourse
Description: among students who were currently sexually active

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not use birth control pills before last sexual intercourse
Description: to prevent pregnancy, among students who were currently sexually active

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not use birth control pills; an IUD (e.g., Mirena or ParaGard) or implant (e.g., Implanon or Nexplanon); or a shot (e.g., Depo-Provera), patch (e.g., OrthoEvra), or birth control ring (e.g., NuvaRing) before last sexual intercourse
Description: to prevent pregnancy, among students who were currently sexually active

Greater_Risk_Question: Did not use both a condom during last sexual intercourse and birth control pills; an IUD (e.g., Mirena or ParaGard) or implant (e.g., Implanon or Nexplanon); or a shot (e.g., Depo-Provera), patch (e.g., OrthoEvra), or birth control ring (e.g., NuvaRing) before last sexual intercourse
Description: to prevent pregnancy, among students who were currently sexually active

Greater_Risk_Question: Drank alcohol or used drugs before last sexual intercourse
Description: among students who were currently sexually active

Had sexual intercourse for the first time before age 13 years
Had sexual intercourse with four or more persons during their life
Were currently sexually active

Description: on at least 1 day during the 30 days before the survey

Description: even one or two puffs

Description: even one or two puffs

Description: on the days they smoked during the 30 days before the survey, among students who currently smoked cigarettes

Greater_Risk_Question: Currently frequently used an electronic vapor product
Description: including e-cigarettes, e-cigars, e-pipes, vape pipes, vaping pens, e-hookahs, and hookah pens, on 20 or more days during the 30 days before the survey
